definition: head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
banging away clumsily in all directions with no overall vision
pinyin: dong1 yi1 lang2 tou2 xi1 yi1 bang4 zi5

sentences.english: Go and ask the neighbours if we can borrow their hammer.
sentences.chinese: 去問鄰居們借用一下他們的榔頭。

sentences.english: The coupling bolts should go into place when tapped lightly with a hammer.
sentences.chinese: 用榔頭輕輕敲擊可將接合螺母釘入位置。

sentences.english: Here is a hammer and lots of tacks.
sentences.chinese: 有一個榔頭和很多大頭針。

sentences.english: Some may need replacement parts such as hammers or felts.
sentences.chinese: 有些部件可能需要更換，比如說榔頭和呢氈。

sentences.english: She swung the hammer at his head with all her might.
sentences.chinese: 她使出全身力氣掄起榔頭砸向他的腦袋。

sentences.english: The "Iron Hammer" signs on to coach Guangdong Evergrande Women's Volleyball Club.
sentences.chinese: “鐵榔頭”郎平簽約廣東恆大女籃俱樂部教練。

sentences.english: Here, cop hold of the screwdriver while I try the hammer.
sentences.chinese: 喂，握住這把改錐，我用榔頭試試。

definition: (usu used in the negative) to be of importance or to matter/to be in the way/to be a hindrance
to fly into a rage out of humiliation/to be ashamed into anger (idiom)
short note/slip of paper/stripe/(slang) cop/(old) prostitute
